p:
The 1918 â€˜Spanish' influenza pandemic was caused by an H1N1 virus, and is known as the deadliest single event recorded in recent human history, killing as many as 50 million people worldwide.
3 The mortality rates were unusually high among young adults, a phenomenon that remains poorly understood to this day. Although its origin has not been fully resolved,
3, 6 data suggest that the 1918 virus evolved from an avian virus around 1910, with or without adaptation in an intermediate host.
7
